headline: Enchiladas Suizas
description: Enchiladas suizas are Swiss-style enchiladas filled with shredded chicken and cheese, baked in a creamy sauce made with heavy cream and salsa verde.

video.description: An irresistible and cheesy-good Mexican dinner!
video.name: Enchilada Suizas

name: Enchiladas Suizas
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons canola oil for frying, or as needed
2 cups shredded, cooked chicken breast meat

recipeInstructions.text: Make the salsa verde: Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and sauté until soft, about 5 minutes. Add flour and stir until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Pour in broth, then add green chiles, garlic, salt, and cumin. Simmer until flavors have blended, about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C.)
Make the enchiladas: Mix Monterey Jack and Cheddar together in a bowl.
Heat 1/4 inch oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Fry tortillas, one at a time, until blistering but still soft enough to roll, 10 to 20 seconds per side. Drain on paper towels.

Dip both sides of each tortilla in salsa verde, then place onto a work surface. Place 2 heaping tablespoons chicken and about 2 tablespoons cheese mixture down the center and roll tortilla around fillings. Place, seam-side down, into a shallow baking dish. Repeat to fill and roll remaining tortillas.
Spoon some salsa verde over enchiladas and pour in heavy cream. Sprinkle remaining cheese mixture over top and garnish with green onions.

Bake, uncovered, in the preheated oven until sauce is bubbly and cheese is melted, about 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and garnish with olives and cherry tomatoes. Serve immediately with remaining salsa verde on the side.

review.reviewBody: Very delightful!!
DEEEElicious!!!!

If you want the real deal, then use Swiss cheese. That said...The recipe is VERY good, but only if it is made as directed. Simply microwaving the tortillas isn't accomplishing what the frying does, which is to prevent the tortillas from absorbing all the sauce and disintegrating. Rate the recipe people, not your "tweaks" and changes. That's YOUR recipe, not this one.
I twerked the verde sauce a bit, but it still came out amazing! Even the kids enjoyed it. definitely making this more often, super easy, super fun to make, and most importantly delicious!
I have been making this recipe for decades. , ALWAYS Perfect. I make guacamole and sour cream to top Do NOT skip the cream. Just make it per instructions, at least for the first time.
Really good - but time intensive. I only make these for my husband on special occasions His favorite dish that I make!
It was seriously so delicious and very easy! 10/10 would do again
Yummy, I made it in a frenzy, but it still turned out okay. I will definitely try it again.
I used bottled green Suiza sauce to speed up prep. They were still a big hit for my husband and I. I'm getting 3 dinners by freezing servings.

I tried this recipe last night. YUM! The flavor is wonderful but a little mild for my tastes so I ended up putting a few dashes of smoky chipotle pepper sauce on top. Delish! I did struggle a bit with the whole fry-dip-fill-roll process, so I simplified by spreading a thin layer of the chili sauce on the bottom of the baking dish, then fried a tortilla, set it in the dish, added sauce/chicken/cheese, then rolled. My family loved them and said I should practice by making more!

Great recipe but I changed it up a bit. I used red corn tortillas. Instead of making sauce I used the bottle Herdez salsa verde and guacamole salsa. I used shredded chicken and added sour cream to the heavy whipping cream. I had some shredded chicken left over so I spreaded on top of the enchiladas then added the whipping, sour cream and cheese & green onion. My family loved it.

I had these at our fav mexican restaurant recently and wanted to make. These were good but i made a few adjustments and I should have used flour tortillas just because thats what i prefer. I used a can of chopped green chiles instead of chopping fresh. I also added black olives instead of green. Overall very yum!
I made these and my traditional Mexican husband likes the. and picky eater son asks for them almost every week. I freeze leftover leftover filling. I also add Chiles and consume to the sauce fr.

I made it gluten free with gf tortillas that got pan fried in butter before filling. We favor extra cheese in our dishes too, so... I added a scoop of the following mixture along with the meat mix: blend of ricotta, sour cream, Mexican cheese mix, and taco seasoning. Really tasty, rich dish.
Kids eat all of it. I like it spicy and added jalapeños.
So good. I did half the amount of canned chiles so my kids would eat it. tastes so good even without the spice.

So good! I followed the suggestion of microwaving the tortillas instead of frying them. It worked perfectly. I used canned chilies. This was a HUGE hit in my house and I can’t wait to make it again. Thank you for this recipe!

This is almost as good as my favourite enchiladas served at my favourite Mexican restaurant in Arizona. I had to use Costco canned chicken because that was all I had on hand. I also added some red pepper with the onion and used a can of green chiles(all I had on hand). I was worried about getting the tortillas too crispy to roll so I didn’t brown them enough. Next time I’ll let them brown a bit more. Really good and easy recipe to throw together in a hurry. Thanks for sharing.
This recipe was awesome!! I used canned enchilada sauce (a little too spicy). So, I added the chopped onions, butter and flour and thinned it with chicken broth. We both loved it!!
This one was just not for us. Made as directed. We found it lacked flavor and the heavy cream just gave everything a milky flavor.
Huge hit with the family!
made with canned pork, i can black beans, 1/2 c light sour cream, 1 can of green chilies for stuffing, sauce was great. used pork juice drained from can , 505 hatch chili delicious.
This was very good. just the right amount of everything, followed the recipe and made no changes. Topped with black olives.
Great recipe!! Absolutely loved. Took the recommendation and deviated from the recipe's chicken. Made chicken tinga instead. Used more cheese because we like our enchiladas cheesy. So yummy

This was absolutely delicious. I did not make as is. I used canned chicken because I had it on hand, canned green chilies and I did not fry the tortillas I used soft flour tortillas and omitted all the garnish at the end.I had left over beef from a roast I shredded and made half chicken half beef. They were both absolutely delicious. I would not omit the cream it is a secret part of what makes this recipe stand out to me. I also used about half a cup more cheese than suggested
Made vegetarian version. Substituted water for chicken broth. Omitted chicken. Used the only cheese I had, shredded cheddar, and canned tomatoes and yellow onion. Delicious.
Yummy....so good and easy!

really good! whole family liked it, definitely a keeper. I made a batch w corn and a batch w flour and personally prefer the flour. I think it is worth frying the tortillas as the recipe says, allows for a little crispiness. these were not spicy at all, next time I will add a bit more spice, and bake just a little longer. I served with black beans.
So good. This has earned a place in the meal planning rotation. Yummy!
It was great. I followed the recipe and it was declared by the 14 year old the best dinner we have had thus far....since December. I'll take it.
This is a great recipe, I use it at least once a year, the tomatoes are a nice touch!
Very good but needs more spice. Would add cumin/chili powder to the sauce.

Next time: 
- bake time: 25 mins 
- make sure you have green onion
- heating in micro is fine

This was the best, non-tomatillo- verde recipe I have made so far! Fun and easy, and absolutely delicious! 
I did not have cream, so I took sour cream and whole milk as a replacement. It turned out great! Will be making this often!
Excellent Recipe... I changed it up a little adding avocado and cilantro.
Use 8 oz can of diced green chilies and 2 Tbls diced jalepeno's. increase measurements for sauce.
Super easy to make. I made a second time with pork, mozzarella cheese, and cheddar cheese. Super delicious and easy

I've had another go to enchilada recipe from this site for years, decided to try this one tonight and it blows the other recipe out of the water. This was delicious. No complaints about anything. Frying the tortilla shells was a gamechanger. My son who hates enchiladas actually liked this recipe. Highly recommend making this one. A little time consuming but so worth it.
Amazing dish. As someone mentioned you do need to blend the salsa Verde sauce and it doesn’t say that in the directions but definitely a key thing to do the dishes amazing?

This recipe made an absolutely delicious meal! I substituted jalapeno and habanero peppers for the sauce and added black beans to the stuffing mixture. It was like having a meal prepared at a restaurant, and preparation didn't take long at all. Highly recommend!
Really good
Fantastic recipe, added green pepper because I didn’t have enough green chilies.

I made this and it’s Amazing! I didn’t use the red or green Bell Peppers, but I did add a a large mild Jalapeños. I freeze these sometimes for a quick Dinner and it’s simply delicious! I highly recommend this dish! I’m a Texas Girl and I think that qualifies me to give this recipe an “ Authentic” Seal of Approval!

It took me a little longer than suggested. But the results were great. I didn't have any heavy cream so I improvised and combined some Greek yogurt with milk to thin it out and only used half the suggested amount since I wasn't sure what the outcome would be. It was actually quite good. I liked this recipe!
Even the kids approved! I added mushrooms and jalapeños the parents and kept the kids ones simple. My tip is make the salsa verde in a large pan big enough to dip the tortilla shells.
very tasty, made as is.

Killer recipe! The most time consuming & tedious for me was paying attention to the fry-time of the corn tortillas so they wouldn't burn and could still fold them. I did each side of each tortilla for 1min. I seasoned my chicken tenders & boiled them for approx. 10 min, resulting in juicy meat easily shred once cooled. EXCELLENT RECIPE. No complaints here.

My boyfriend LOVED this recipe. He is definitely not a leftover fan & vary rarely goes back for seconds but for these he had 3 total along with cabbage/Pico de Gallo & Cilantro Lime Rice. First I warmed my Tortillas in a skillet on med/high & used an oil spritzer which works great. I downsized to a serving size of 6. I only added 1 cup of broth rather than 1 1/2 that was called for, I also used leftover Pork instead of Chicken & to the Verda mix I sprinkled in some dry Fajita mix to taste. Everything else stayed the same & between the two of us there was only 1 1/2 enchiladas left. Guess that will be my lunch for tomorrow. :-)

This was really good! 
I put a hand full of pepper jack cheese in it to give an extra kick.
Definitely going to make this again!
These enchiladas are great!
Great dish. I didn't have any green chilies so I roasted some hatch chilies. The sauce was really thick sine I added too much flour. We really enjoyed this recipe and will make it again
The family really liked it. I forgot to fry the tortillas, but I guess they were soft enough to roll well. Next time I will chop my onions much much smaller, and maybe puree the sauce.
This was fabulous! I did not know that my family would like green salsa so much!
Tasted great. I used light cream and heavy cream. Next time I think I will just use light cream. Skipped the olives and tomatoes for the top. Didn’t even need them.

Great recipe! Love the freshness of the green peppers, I used poblanos. Next time I will purée half the sauce to add a bit more consistency and creaminess to it. Definitely keeping this one, I’ve made 5 times so far!
Best enchiladas ever! As other reviewers said, don't be afraid of the cream. It makes the dish. We had left over rotisserie chicken and just added some taco seasoning.

I've longed looked for a good enchilada recipe, and usually disappointed. This is authentic, restaurant quality. Previous recipes I made are a soggy mess. The difference with this recipe is lightly frying the corn tortillas - they bake up nicely and are not soggy. Also the cream really adds to the sauce. It is delicious.
Great recipe!! Great foundation and added more spices to your taste!
Restaurant quality, probably better than most restaurants.
I got 4 thumbs up from my family of 4 they absolutely loved this recipe. I used Trader Joe's corn and wheat tortillas which added a little sweet touch to it. This is staying in my recipe book.

Great recipe!
I only made one change. After making the verde, I put the sauce in the blender to make it smooth. Turned out perfect. I will be making it again.
It was very yummy! Used black olives instead of green.

My kids stopped eating several times just to tell me how good it was! Then went back for seconds! So delicious. A little time consuming and it helped that I got everything set out and ready, but it wasn't overly complicated. Made it right off the recipe and didn't need to change a thing, it was just so so good!

I have made this twice now. It came out very well both times. I saved some calories by warming the tortillas in the microwave to make them pliable and easy to fill and roll.
 this saved time, calories and mess. also, I used half and half instead of heavy cream and used less. my family loves it and I'll make it again and again.

Of all the Swiss Enchiladas I have prepared over the last 50 years or so this is by far one of my favorites, there is something about frying the tortillas lightly that makes them taste extra good, I sprinkle a small amount of Parmesan cheese on the inside of the tortilla, a trick a Mexican food truck vendor told me about years ago in California and it's the only addition I made.
It is very easy to make and is so delicious! My husband who is not a fan of mexican food raved about the meal
Delicious but time consuming. Next time I might just layer it up and make a casserole. But, it was a huge hit!!

This recipe was delicious. I did purchase the salsa verde from the refrigerated section at the grocery store. Since there are only two of us, I made three 8x8 pans. One for dinner that night, one for the freezer and one went to a friend to enjoy. My husband loved it. This is definitely a keeper.

Delicious! I used pork,and flour tortillas those were the only changes I made just because if preferred taste.
Before serving I put a dallop of sour cream on top of each enchilada with tomatoes and black olives.
This was a big success!!
Great as the recipe is written. We loved it!
I combined the Slow Cooker Cilantro Lime Chicken and added it into Enchiladas Suizas recipe. It was soooo delicious, already a family favorite.

Super easy, and very tasty. I used ground turkey meat because I had some in the freezer, and 1/2 and 1/2 because I needed to use it up. I also seasoned the meat a bit with onion and garlic powder, seasoned salt and pepper, a little oregano. Otherwise followed the recipe as written. This one's definitely a keeper!

AMAZING! what I did to make this so much easier..
first I did not roll the shells, I layered them like a casserole. I boiled the chicken and used the broth adding chicken bullion. Pre packaged mexican cheese. 2 small cans of diced chilis (this added so much great flavor). I did not dip the first batch of shells in the sauce .
I made sauce, poured some down in the empty dish and smoothed it around, fried tortillas slightly and I honestly think this is a must even thought it is a huge process(fried tortillas have a different taste and consistency). Then I layered the first shells , and flipped the first shells around in the sauce that was already in the dish, meat, cheese, fry next batch, dip is sauce, layer on top, rest of the sauce plus heavy cream, then 1/2 of second pack of cheese on on top , green onion and bake 20 min. = restaurant style enchiladas to die for.
***Also the reason I even tried this recipe was because I was tired of throwing away tortilla shells that were broken in the package. So this is an excellent recipe for people like me who always have a lot of broken shells and can't use them for tacos, save'em and make this meal.

Delicious! Based on some of the reviews, I doubled the sauce and subbed out a green bell pepper for some of the green chili peppers, to adjust the spice for my family. I did fry the tortillas in oil and will do
just double sauce. I used a lot of chicken.

Don’t skip the step where you lightly fry the corn tortillas. It keeps the enchiladas from turning to mush, and it only adds maybe 5 minutes to the process. I cheated and used canned chicken because I had a bunch in the pantry, and they STILL tasted amazing. If your enchiladas can survive canned chicken, you know they can survive just about anything!
Delicious!

These were just okay. They were super mild and did not have a lot of flavor. I added more cumin, salt, and chili powder but it didn’t make a difference. If I were to make it again, I’d make sure my green chiles were spicier or just use a premade sauce.
Will add this to our list of keepers! The whole family loved it and my teenager ate 3!
I used leftover rotisserie chicken, 2 4oz cans of green chiles, 1/2c sc mixed with 1/2c of water, 8 flax tortillas , mex shredded cheese. Needs a little heat. baked 30 min 350. Fed 4 adults.
I made this as is for game night and everyone loved it.
Really good!

Really good. I used Greek yogurt instead of cream because I didn't have cream, but I had yogurt. This is my first attempt at making enchiladas and my wife said "Lets have this again", so that's why this rates 5 stars.

I didn't exactly follow the recipe, because I never do, but I got raves from my guests. No major changes except that I didn't cover with cream. I used blanched, seeded jalapenos in the sauce. I thought it would be too spicy, but it wasn't. The leftovers were a bit soggy reheated the next day.

followed the recipe and result was good but a little bland. a little chilula sauce made a world of difference. it may be due to using canned chilies?as my local grocery store didn’t have any fresh ones. i may also use pepperjack cheese instead of montery jack for some kick and also add some type of seasoning to the meat (i used chicken) after its been shredded. it’s a solid recipe and one i’ll make again.
I made it for the second time. used the heat the shell in the microwave method and also mixed ground chicken into my shredded cheese for the filling.

I made this tonight for dinner; my kids loved it! They are very similar to the way my family makes green enchiladas, but I've never added cream like that before-it was delicious! Unfortunately I was short on time so I used a can of salsa verde enchilada sauce, next time I'll make per the recipe. everything else was made as directed, I'll be making these again!
Delicious!
I don't make any changes. It's a huge hit!
Very tasty dish. A bit complex, but worth it. Next time I make it, I will make more sauce.

I love this dish. I've cooked it several times in the past few weeks. Always good. Easy to adjust for personal taste. I leave out the garlic and don't bother frying the tortillas. I also occasionally add extra peppers or rice.

This was a great recipe! I used 3/4 cup salsa verde vs. 1 cup green chiles to keep the heat down some for kids. No other changes and it was not a soggy mess at all. Frying the tortillas was a little work, but worth it! I would make this again no question!
Fantastic flavor. A huge hit with my husband. Love the green olives with it. Unexpected pleasure!
Fantastic flavor. A huge hit with my husband. Love the green olives with it. Unexpected pleasure!

I tried making this recipe but traditional salsa verde is made with tomatillos and only a couple of Serrano chiles not with green chiles alone. And my tia taught me to steam the corn tortillas for enchiladas just a bit so that they are pliable for rolling. I didn’t want the extra grease so I did not put them in hot oil at all. I’m going back to my tia’s recipe for these enchiladas.

I made it more or less as described, but found a way to assemble it more easily. I fried the corn tortillas but did not dip them in the salsa. I found that awkward the first time I made them. I poured some salsa into the bottom of the casserole dish, and put a spoonful of salsa on each tortilla before adding the chicken and cheese. They were much easier to handle being dry on the outside and pouring the salsa over them in the casserole got the outside of each enchilada. My girlfriend and I loved it and will make it again for sure.

Excellent creamy and cheesy eating! I used previously roasted and frozen hatch green chilies, which were delicious but a pain to peel, which significantly increased the prep time. I also used flour tortillas because that was what I had on hand. I found them to be a bit too doughy and dense when cooked, so I would definitely use corn tortillas in the future. Still, a delicious recipe that I will be using again soon!
Made exactly as written and it was absolutely delicious. Will make again next time I have one of those Costco roasted chickens.

Really loved this yummy recipe. Even picky teenager gave a thumbs up. Made simpler by using roasted chicken & bottled salsa verde. Used flour tortilla and increased amounts of salsa & cheese. Will definitely put this recipe in the line up.
